trans-unit.source: Allows programmatic access to the HTML `<meta>` tag on the server.
The <xref:System.Web.UI.HtmlControls.HtmlMeta> control provides programmatic access to the HTML `<meta>` element on the server.
The HTML `<meta>` element is a container for data about the rendered page, but not page content itself.
The `<meta>` tag is placed between the opening and closing HTML `<head>` elements.
Each `<meta>` element describes a metadata property name and its associated value.

Use the <xref:System.Web.UI.HtmlControls.HtmlMeta> control's <xref:System.Web.UI.HtmlControls.HtmlMeta.Name%2A> property to specify the metadata property name, and the <xref:System.Web.UI.HtmlControls.HtmlMeta.Content%2A> property to specify the metadata property value.
Use the <xref:System.Web.UI.HtmlControls.HtmlMeta.Scheme%2A> property to specify additional information to user agents on how to interpret the metadata property.

Use the <xref:System.Web.UI.HtmlControls.HtmlMeta.HttpEquiv%2A> property in place of the <xref:System.Web.UI.HtmlControls.HtmlMeta.Name%2A> property when the resulting metadata property will be retrieved using HTTP.
You can get a reference to the page `<head>` element using the <xref:System.Web.UI.Page.Header%2A> property of the <xref:System.Web.UI.Page> object.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Web.UI.HtmlControls.HtmlMeta"></xref> class.
Use this constructor to create and initialize a new instance of the <xref:System.Web.UI.HtmlControls.HtmlMeta> control.
The following table shows initial property values for an instance of <xref:System.Web.UI.HtmlControls.HtmlMeta>.
Property
Initial Value
The "meta" literal string.
Gets or sets the metadata property value defined by the <xref href="System.Web.UI.HtmlControls.HtmlMeta"></xref> control.
The <xref:System.Web.UI.HtmlControls.HtmlMeta.Content%2A> property, together with the <xref:System.Web.UI.HtmlControls.HtmlMeta.Name%2A> property, defines a metadata property of the page.
The <xref:System.Web.UI.HtmlControls.HtmlMeta.Content%2A> property is rendered to the `content` attribute of the resulting HTML `<meta>` element.
The metadata property value.
Gets or sets an <xref href="System.Web.UI.HtmlControls.HtmlMeta"></xref> control property that is included in the HTTP response header.

Use the <xref:System.Web.UI.HtmlControls.HtmlMeta.HttpEquiv%2A> property in place of the <xref:System.Web.UI.HtmlControls.HtmlMeta.Name%2A> property to identify information that should be included in the response headers of an HTTP request.
The <xref:System.Web.UI.HtmlControls.HtmlMeta.HttpEquiv%2A> property is rendered to the `http-equiv` attribute of the resulting HTML `<meta>` element.
The name of the HTTP response header item.
Gets or sets the metadata property name defined by the <xref href="System.Web.UI.HtmlControls.HtmlMeta"></xref> control.
The <xref:System.Web.UI.HtmlControls.HtmlMeta.Name%2A> property, together with the <xref:System.Web.UI.HtmlControls.HtmlMeta.Content%2A> property, defines a metadata property of the page.
The <xref:System.Web.UI.HtmlControls.HtmlMeta.Name%2A> property is rendered to the `name` attribute of the resulting HTML `<meta>` element.
The property name.
Renders the <xref href="System.Web.UI.HtmlControls.HtmlMeta"></xref> control to the client's browser using the specified <xref href="System.Web.UI.HtmlTextWriter"></xref> object.

The <xref:System.Web.UI.HtmlControls.HtmlMeta> control renders a <xref:System.Web.UI.HtmlTextWriter.SelfClosingTagEnd> HTML bracket (/>) on the `<meta>` element if the client's browser is XHTML compliant.

For more information on configuring ASP.NET for non-XHTML rendering, see [NIB: How to: Configure XHTML Rendering in ASP.NET Web Sites](http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/42483a54-f1ae-44e1-88e6-4370f8690149).
The <xref href="System.Web.UI.HtmlTextWriter"></xref> used to render the <xref href="System.Web.UI.HtmlControls.HtmlMeta"></xref> control's content on the client's browser.
Gets or sets a `scheme` attribute used to interpret the metadata property value defined by the <xref href="System.Web.UI.HtmlControls.HtmlMeta"></xref> control.
The <xref:System.Web.UI.HtmlControls.HtmlMeta.Scheme%2A> property allows you to specify a `scheme` attribute of the rendered HTML `<meta>` element.
The `scheme` attribute can be used to provide user agents, such as client browsers or search engines, additional context for interpreting the metadata property.
The <xref:System.Web.UI.HtmlControls.HtmlMeta.Scheme%2A> property is rendered to the `scheme` attribute of the resulting HTML `<meta>` element.
The `scheme` attribute.
